TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IMobileWebFormServices

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Defines an interface for a page designer component to obtain services from a designer host such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] at design time. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks All methods in this interface are to be implemented by the design host and made available to designer components through this IMobileWebFormServices interface. Before attempting to use the methods in a custom designer component, verify that the design host actually implements the interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearUndoStack() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears all items in the designer host's **Undo** cache at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Since the ClearUndoStack method is implemented by the designer host, verify that it exists before invoking it.

MemberSignature.Value: public object GetCache (string controlID, object key);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetCache(string controlID, object key) cil managed

Docs.param: The ID for the container control.
The key for the cache item.
Docs.summary: Gets an item from the cache of the designer host at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: An object from the cache of the designer host.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Since the GetCache method is implemented by the designer host, verify that it exists before invoking it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RefreshPageView() cil managed

Docs.summary: Refreshes the page in the designer host at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Since the RefreshPageView method is implemented by the designer host, verify that it exists before invoking it.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetCache(string controlID, object key, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: The ID of the container control.
The key for the cache item.
The item to store in the cache.
Docs.summary: Stores an object in the designer host's cache at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UpdateRenderingRecursive(class System.Web.UI.Control rootControl) cil managed

Docs.param: The container control with which to begin the update.
Docs.summary: Recursively updates the associated control and each of its child controls in the design host at design time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
